subtitle: foreign
I'm an astrologer and researcher in
Boulder Colorado in the United States
I came across a strange anomaly that I'd
like to share with you
I use Mathematica for most of my coding
projects besides math IT Supplies many
secondary tools one of which is an
events database providing a start date
and a short description for almost 8 000
events which is probably not too many in
the big picture
a world cloud of the descriptions shows
the most common words
actually this is constrained in two
important ways
one was that I only included the
7153 events that began at or after
January 1st 1600 A.D so that events with
earlier Julian dates would not be
included
secondly I removed numerals so that for
example the battle of 1812 would become
the battle of
I want to check for an association
between these short descriptions and the
astrology charts for the dates for the
events they describe
this is why I want to remove numbers in
the descriptions
for example two events described as
occurring in 1812 but de facto have
similar descriptions and similar charts
so I want to avoid that artifact
the number of pairs of the
7153 events was a simple combinatorial
of that number take two resulting in
over 25 million pairs
to measure similarities in the text
descriptions of each pair the scalar dot
product of the embeddings from the
bi-directional encoder called Bert from
Google was used
to measure similarities in the charts of
the pairs I used a scalar result of
adding the cosines of the differences
between the astrology placements for the
Sun the moon Mercury Venus mirrors
Jupiter Saturn Neptune Uranus Pluto
North lunar node and South lunar node
this resulted in a continuously defined
single number that ranges from -12 for
chart pairs that are all at 180 degrees
across the 12 placements through zero
first squares are the way to positive 12
for conjunctions for the 12 placements
only plot imagery of the two
measurements suggests dependence but not
monotonic correlation
the null hypothesis here then is that
the measures of description similarity
and a chart similarity have nothing to
do with each other that they are
independent
I want to test the only alternative
hypothesis
that the strict Converse of the null
hypothesis is true that one is dependent
on the other
one measurement is dependent on the
other measurement
because demonstration of correlative
monotonicity is not desired but shown
dependence is I use the appropriate
hoofting's Independence test this is an
integral based statistic that uses
ranked values sort of like experiments
rank does
calculating the statistic for the four
data set was prohibitedly expensive
computationally the calculation was
aborted after six days so a p hat upper
value for the p-value was calculated
instead the approach is simple use a
multi-color resampling of one million
random pairs done a hundred times
upper Bound for the p-value is then
simply R plus 1 divided by one hundred
plus one but R is the number of
samplings with a higher p-value than the
culturally accepted one for significance
in fact no we're sampling out of the
hundred resulted in such a p-value
in fact they were also infinitesimally
small they were smaller than the chance
of you reaching out your hand and
grabbing one particular random electron
out of all the electrons in the universe
thus the P hat upper Bound for the
p-value here is simply one divided by
101 Which is less than 0.01
so in this study the null hypothesis of
Independence turns out to be
statistically extremely unlikely
therefore the strict Converse is applied
that one measurement is dependent on the
other
use this QR code to access references
and default calculations including that
for generation of data thank you
